sentence.Network_en: Residents in general are poor and undereducated, and live in sub-standard housing.
sentence.Network_cn: 居民们普遍都很贫穷，受教育程度低，居住条件较差。

sentence.Network_en: The ferry service has restarted after an interval of 12 years.
sentence.Network_cn: 时隔12年之后，轮渡服务又重新开通了。

sentence.Network_en: Men carrying sub-machine guns seized the five soldiers and drove them away.
sentence.Network_cn: 持冲锋枪的几名男子俘虏了5名士兵并开车将他们带走。

means.word_mean: 1. an interval that is included in another interval

auth_sentence.content: I told them to stop treating us as sub-humans.
auth_sentence.res_content: I told them to stop treating us as sub-humans.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I told them to stop treating us as sub-humans.

auth_sentence.content: However, Quins overpowered the visitors after the interval.
auth_sentence.res_content: However, Quins overpowered the visitors after the interval.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: However, Quins overpowered the visitors after the interval.

auth_sentence.content: He said the sub-regional body sharply condemns the violence.
auth_sentence.res_content: He said the sub-regional body sharply condemns the violence.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He said the sub-regional body sharply condemns the violence.
